document.title: Archdiocese of Milwaukee Curriculum Guide, Grade 2

47003DB4968346A2B1BEF2B53EBDB5DF.description: Write an equation with repeated equal addends from an array

8CEE35B6D21A4EEC9D35F30A389C555A.description: Solve repeated addition problems to find the number of objects using rectangular arrays

AD963DB7FEAA42B683AA9BAE3D8714C9.description: Generalize the fact that arrays can be written as repeated addition problems

7775B18D85A842B281B0FE05F23476E4.description: Use addition to find the total number of objects arranged in rectangular arrays with up to 5 rows and up to 5 columns; write an equation to express the total as a sum of equal addends.

461C6589E23C42B7BE81153E97AF9437.description: Write an equation to express a given even number as a sum of two equal addends

9357A619F5D9477DA7905761A9BBD6B8.description: Count a group of objects up to 20 by 2s

3D357849E5E34C7B9A8BD13846760857.description: Generalize the fact that all even numbers can be formed from the addition of 2 equal addends

9764948779594D028958C3094C481703.description: Determine whether a group of objects is odd or even, using a variety of strategies

5F81EB22A1F4443685888B0F8E696058.description: Recognize that in groups of odd numbers objects will not pair up evenly

46A9924269AA4B949647EA6B4672E9D9.description: Recognize that in groups of even numbers objects will pair up evenly

EA5974F7EC334FE498C07A6E33391B6C.description: Determine whether a group of objects (up to 20) has an odd or even number of members, e.g., by pairing objects or counting them by 2s; write an equation to express an even number as a sum of two equal addends.

D5D9EA5EF6D746ACB89FC971AB4F9A38.description: Apply mental strategies to add and subtract fluently within 20

9D0DEB8E3D624D24859AA48065745491.description: Know from memory all sums of two one-digit numbers

5E8E168DA7BD465990AC51A5C3C8939B.description: Know mental math strategies for addition and subtraction

7D3BEB43478A44BD9DE3A02A8BC8C519.description: Fluently add and subtract within 20 using mental strategies. By end of Grade 2, know from memory all sums of two one-digit numbers.

51963358FE1F4585A24086F84388246D.description: Write an addition and subtraction equation with a symbol for the unknown

51171F3031F345329B268979CF336AA4.description: Add and subtract within 100 to solve one-step word problems with unknowns in any positions

99A2A87F3B90448EA3019700D3DB8322.description: Use drawings or equations to represent one-and two-step word problems

C79E9FE304FE4DDAB8FF4B20F478AD7F.description:
Determine the appropriate operations needed to solve addition and subtraction problems in situations including
add to, take from, put together, take apart, and compare

2532FABE047C40EAB43BB38414E5BC4C.description: Identify the unknown in addition or subtraction word problem

CD921F73A11F4F1397F99CE6A8FCDA50.description: Use addition and subtraction within 100 to solve one- and two-step word problems involving situations of adding to, taking from, putting together, taking apart, and comparing, with unknowns in all positions, e.g., by using drawings and equations with a symbol for the unknown number to represent the problem.

E26B76DC88954A57AE89E5960445BB99.description: Explain why addition and subtraction strategies based on place value and properties of operations work

CFE5CDF5A4634FD7B04F3CDA591C3795.description:
Know addition and subtraction strategies using place value and properties of operations related to addition and
subtraction

2D6C3C5902DD46209EDFE073E54767ED.description: Explain why addition and subtraction strategies work, using place value and the properties of operations.

CB60BBBE488D4A29B91EAABEEFAF64DC.description: Apply knowledge of place value to mentally add or subtract 10 or 100 to/from a given number 100-900

9D37680984A243A3B5D59D4F130DBB9A.description: Mentally add 10 or 100 to a given number 100-900, and mentally subtract 10 or 100 from a given number 100-900.

525537FBF4D5467287F0E57371CBC1EC.description: Use composition and decomposition of hundreds and tens when necessary to add and subtract within 1000

A38D9836BB0F485E98CEB3E6554F53A7.description:
Relate the chosen strategy (using concrete models or drawings and strategies based on place value, properties of
operations, and/or the relationship between addition and subtraction) to a written method (equation) and
explain the reasoning used

7015CC88734D4B2688BD3CDD2DC07583.description: Choose an appropriate strategy for solving an addition or subtraction problem within 1000

7BC28BC64CB2462EAD47EB3285E3D040.description: Decompose any number within 1000 into hundreds, tens, and ones

6FD5058C19834372B640C34CE8829C10.description: Add and subtract within 1000, using concrete models or drawings and strategies based on place value, properties of operations, and/or the relationship between addition and subtraction; relate the strategy to a written method. Understand that in adding or subtracting three-digit numbers, one adds or subtracts hundreds and hundreds, tens and tens, ones and ones; and sometimes it is necessary to compose or decompose tens or hundreds.

1C4D0491252D4C6D918078DA2E40A039.description: Use strategies to add up to four two-digit numbers

77C8C80FA92D4CBF9FD00212D0D874CE.description: Know strategies for adding two-digit numbers based on place value and properties of operations

C8F4EB22A0C642B8B882B360E4A7094E.description: Add up to four two-digit numbers using strategies based on place value and properties of operations.

1EF89FBE6AF848B08A509B02B1CDDD0D.description:
Choose a strategy (place value, properties of operations, and/or the relationship between addition and
subtraction) to fluently add and subtract within 100

7090147E8B964109A708C29BE56710C1.description: Know strategies for adding and subtracting based on the relationship between addition and subtraction

8F544449363249DD99F63ED7A747BB77.description: Know strategies for adding and subtracting based on properties of operations

127DEB350C1A4A8E95285721BD1CD3AF.description: Know strategies for adding and subtracting based on place value

250660892E9849628296CB8B6CE09C67.description: Fluently add and subtract within 100 using strategies based on place value, properties of operations, and/or the relationship between addition and subtraction.

CAD4AA72001E4DF6ABC8D21E3798E9C5.description: Use >, =, and > symbols to record the results of comparisons

6BB1670ADB384FA990D1BF9D742E2E0D.description: Compare two three-digit numbers based on place value of each digit

61C0D27BCF974C528FFEC0C0C36A9945.description: Know the value of each digit represented in a three-digit number

4698A46534FA402AAA42C1D694B813EA.description: Compare two three-digit numbers based on meanings of the hundreds, tens, and ones digits, using >, =, and < symbols to record the results of comparisons.

EB76709B89B7476BA10DA4D237D84B1E.description: Write numbers to 1000 using expanded form

90C515C233704F95BA4ED407F90EC567.description: Write numbers to 1000 using number names

A21AF8899497424FBBAA7F08D097CA5C.description: Write numbers to 1000 using base ten numerals

D54D283EBFFC4AC7B613A73283B5B52D.description: Read numbers to 1000 using expanded form

A816FACAC86D4F3FAA94B178625B1856.description: Read numbers to 1000 using number names

3CABBBB16A58442191B484DAC5AC968E.description: Read numbers to 1000 using base ten numerals

FB51A7D8815E47228E6401C13CC7BBD6.description: Recognize that the digits in each place represent amounts of thousands, hundreds, tens, or ones

C506951E16A34DB2BE3AE8C42C1947EA.description: Read and write numbers to 1000 using base-ten numerals, number names, and expanded form.

EF2B52C60DBB4371A21623A196129757.description:
Represent 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, 900 with one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, or nine
hundreds and 0 tens and 0 ones

64F5202CE07742A1BA0292133BB8063C.description: Represent a three-digit number with hundreds, tens, and ones

1C538443A313481DAE6EEEF3615DEF6D.description: Identify a bundle of 10 tens as a “hundred”

8CDE6FF6AE3D4C7F86474C6A8CD97272.description: Explain the value of each digit in a three-digit number

678B0A02F6FA406AB87244C7AF34637B.description: Understand that the three digits of a three-digit number represent amounts of hundreds, tens, and ones; e.g., 706 equals 7 hundreds, 0 tens, and 6 ones.

909299F0A03F44CA93F2ABC8E97F1B35.description: NUMBER AND OPERATIONS IN BASE TEN

E64F56C3D1D745ED8B7EF65BFEE0ECD2.description: Draw a single-unit scale bar graph to represent a given set of data with up to four categories

D410F32FF97347FB97C4932D4A098E5A.description: Draw a single-unit scale picture graph to represent a given set of data with up to four categories

3A2C22C7BD1E4549A408258117860A67.description: Solve problems relating to data in graphs by using addition and subtraction

D561B9E8E9A948D5BCDD6FD16A78BF2B.description: Make comparisons between categories in the graph using more than, less than, etc.

C01A10998F664D159B8025291FDED256.description: Identify and label the components of a picture graph and bar graph

0A74F3AC2A604283B02480C519E112FC.description: Recognize and identify picture graphs and bar graphs

5569BCC577734843813EBDAEC77DB222.description: Draw a picture graph and a bar graph (with single-unit scale) to represent a data set with up to four categories. Solve simple put-together, take-apart, and compare problems1 using information presented in a bar graph.

611EAE7D69C44DD7B5CCCBE520922497.description: Create a line plot with a horizontal scale marked in whole numbers using measurements

BC6E512C667A406EAACF47218A9DB4C8.description: Measure lengths of objects by making repeated measurements of the same object

2964D71A2F1048818CBE7A7827447AD4.description: Measure lengths of several objects to the nearest whole unit

DD4DFB5E58EB4972B3799D929F81131C.description: Represent measurement data on a line plot

959EB4CD94CB42F0A707FE3309D7AB3D.description: Read tools of measurement to the nearest unit

AB31B4EF4D3B40BFA7D5F771D59107A1.description: Generate measurement data by measuring lengths of several objects to the nearest whole unit, or by making repeated measurements of the same object. Show the measurements by making a line plot, where the horizontal scale is marked off in whole-number units.

8828AD9DCDEA4FE9AB70011D86FE1E27.description:
Solve word problems involving dollar bills, quarters, dimes, nickels, and pennies using $ and ₵ symbols
appropriately

79549F4C3EFB4A599D871CE336C5FA18.description: Identify and recognize the value of dollar bills, quarters, dimes, nickels, and pennies

15BDAB95C87A4006A4DABB68F8B7982B.description: Solve word problems involving dollar bills, quarters, dimes, nickels, and pennies, using $ and ¢ symbols appropriately. Example: If you have 2 dimes and 3 pennies, how many cents do you have?

9853D7B77D77452F8B338E5A9EFB0602.description:  Identify and label when a.m. and p.m. occur

942BD97A93A648A5B02D0BB817F41ECB.description: Identify the hour and minute hand on an analog clock

543240AAD19944288F38924FDC9990F7.description: Write time using analog clocks and digital clocks

04F74AB0ED0B4F7F86E3C714D10C74A0.description: Tell time using digital clocks to the nearest 5 minutes

6A686BA73B644EFDAB6B190A0D2CE5AA.description: Tell time using analog clocks to the nearest 5 minutes

753946CCE4234FB2875646D47E0BD2D9.description:
Determine what time is represented by the combination of the number on the clock face and the position of the
hands

0B982CCB4D734F6BBD454F6E2114DF10.description: Tell and write time from analog and digital clocks to the nearest five minutes, using a.m. and p.m.

3AF85D522E9F4A248CC7D16A36B96EE3.description: Use a number line to represent the solution of whole number sums and differences related to length within 100

35C4AECE2F3941AB9AEB5DE190C91400.description: Explain length as the distance between 0 and another mark on the number line diagram

C61963B88F424EF5A853B98DB5E2D191.description: Represent whole numbers from 0 on a number line with equally spaced points

FEF06A840F004FDAA6B34866C513388C.description: Represent whole numbers as lengths from 0 on a number line diagram with equally spaced points corresponding to the numbers 0, 1, 2, ..., and represent whole-number sums and differences within 100 on a number line diagram.

9CFCFF7C9DD64345A778BC1DE5E58296.description: Solve word problems involving length that have equations with a symbol for the unknown number

62019FEF64F147138D4F5C636DA546A4.description: Solve word problems involving lengths that are given in the same units

13F7ED555DAB46F5843DC8151BA5C194.description: Use addition and subtraction within 100 to solve word problems involving lengths that are given in the same units, e.g., by using drawings (such as drawings of rulers) and equations with a symbol for the unknown number to represent the problem.

11CFD04921DD4E71982F651F235A863F.description: Determine how much longer one object is than another in standard length units

EEB78CB096854541A01785EB4544BFF1.description: Measure to determine how much longer one object is than another, expressing the length difference in terms of a standard length unit.

AE8A80545F7E4C7FA002A96AB271904E.description: Estimate lengths in units of inches, feet, centimeters, and meters

3409FB15182A4085B9BF82A68D90AFD4.description: Determine if an estimate is reasonable

FC66BC38D0FC4684BEDADFCBACA4B397.description: Recognize the size of inches, feet, centimeters, and meters

0FF88A961E014301B3CEB3753DE17525.description: Estimate lengths using units of inches, feet, centimeters, and meters.

97BCF39653964DF5A2E2E6AEFEB997FA.description: Explain the length of an object in relation to the size of the units used to measure it

80D2D19F66FB48D58325EA853FC22008.description: Describe why the measurements of an object taken with two different units are different

6C3668F535B04A37B27E17186D71B795.description: Compare measurements of an object taken with two different units

E58B8A7A6F4741F8A141892FD180DEEA.description: Know how to measure the length of objects with different units

CEE745101EE84429B4D08D69ABD7CEF0.description: Measure the length of an object twice, using length units of different lengths for the two measurements; describe how the two measurements relate to the size of the unit chosen.

532D3EFD93B548398C9AC1E1D92A51B9.description: Measure the length of objects, using appropriate tools

487A78746A5A44B08F96385279F03787.description: Determine which tool is most appropriate to use to measure the length of an object

90D61876DF5349FBB531F643EEDF6A54.description: Identify the unit of length for the tool used (inches, centimeters, feet, meters)

935BC8823DB94AF69441185B0C8F07E4.description: Identify tools that can be used to measure length

5E9889E5BB494D1285625589CBA7F4CF.description: Measure the length of an object by selecting and using appropriate tools such as rulers, yardsticks, meter sticks, and measuring tapes.

5CC66E87B5674E1798679B54EC3C2FC3.description: Justify why equal shares of identical wholes need not have the same shape

14CECDC448094710B358623E2F91D781.description: Describe the whole as two halves, three thirds, or four fourths

735807FF18444B609B7491F2BDC8CCBF.description: Describe equal shares using vocabulary: halves, thirds, fourths, half of, third of, etc

3663C5059E48404DBC979EE58B0FC202.description: Identify two, three, and four equal shares of a whole

710B621318624AB3BD930D7E4EDD6F11.description: Partition circles and rectangles into two, three, or four equal shares, describe the shares using the words halves, thirds, half of, a third of, etc., and describe the whole as two halves, three thirds, four fourths. Recognize that equal shares of identical wholes need not have the same shape.

1EE40B17852C42498998C7F7E4FC33A7.description: Count to find the total number of same-size squares

E5F7F1CA651E46BD9F307A7340ADC3B2.description: Determine how to partition a rectangle into same size squares

232AF38E06D345EB9E538E88821300B1.description: Partition a rectangle into rows and columns of same-size squares and count to find the total number of them.

DDA3BF7644CC4710AAF052FF3A556912.description: Compare shapes by their attributes (e.g., faces, angles)

60FF0B09C161411EA71221D36D0B2C5C.description: Describe and analyze shapes by examining their sides and angles, not by measuring

7A09F8A9BCAD4C93987B4A73975C28CF.description: Identify triangles, quadrilaterals, pentagons, hexagons, and cubes based on the given attributes

F23E7D8C99EF4E9581F3F5BC62060E4B.description:
Identify the attributes of triangles, quadrilaterals, pentagons, hexagons, and cubes (e.g., faces, angles, sides,
vertices, etc.)

904C26152580458080C16E5EC95A617B.description: Recognize and draw shapes having specified attributes, such as a given number of angles or a given number of equal faces.1 Identify triangles, quadrilaterals, pentagons, hexagons, and cubes.
